subject: Re: [junit] use of setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: ... I understand the difference. It s just that 90%+ of the time the difference doesn t matter. Unless you re doing something weird with static variables
messageBody:
Neil Swingler wrote:

> Kevin Lawrence already explained the difference between using
> constructors and setUp. The constructor will be called when building the
> test suite so if you want your tests to be properly isolated, it is
> safer to always perform the intialization work in setUp.

I understand the difference. It's just that 90%+ of the time the
difference doesn't matter. Unless you're doing something weird with
static variables inside your constructors or something similar, the
tests are still properly isolated when using constructors. setUp is just
a very weird thing that only matters in some strange corner cases. It
consistently confuses new users who would be better served by simply
ignoring it until they encounter one of the rare needs for it.

--
